result.execSummary:
The defendant Deon R Batton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered costs, fees and surcharges waived due to low income.

**Court will not allow expungement on this case.**

**03-16-15/ John Siefert**
Defendant failed to report at HOC as ordered.  
Court ordered a Commitment Out For Service.
Court ordered Huber privileges cancelled and Court objects to ES.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence with credit for 4 days time served. Huber to apply for school.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deon R Batton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Amended JOC reflects 03-16-16 Commitment Out For Service order

Defendant Deon R Batton not in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failed to appear at the House of Correction.  Court ordered a commitment out for service.  Original commitment received and filed. Court ordered huber privileges cancelled and court objects to ES.
FAILURE TO REPORT COMMITMENT REFERRAL FORWARDED TO JUDGE SIEFERT BR.47. OS

FAILURE TO REPORT COMMITMENT REFERRAL:
.
Failure to Report Commitment Referral received from the HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge *, Br *, for review.

Defendant Deon R Batton in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 15 days  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 4 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for school. Court stayed the commencment until 3-16-15. 

Court ordered costs , fees and surcharges waived due to low income. 
Court will not allow expungment on this case.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Deon R Batton in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Alyssa M. Schaller  with student appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch
 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-11-2015 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Deon R Batton in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Defendant Deon R Batton in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Pretrial Conference scheduled January 21, 2015 at 1:30pm, Branch 47
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
